nodes.name: getFollowers
oraclizeTweet

nodes.documentation: @param _profileId The twitter post to retrieve and store in the Twitter Oracle contract
nodes.name: oraclizeFollowers

changePayout(uint256,uint256).details: This function requires that the new fulfillment amount is less than available balance for the bounty, which is why this function is also payable

params._bountyId: The bounty the owner is trying to changet the fulfillment amount for
params._newFulfillmentAmount: The new amount that users who fulfill the bounty will be paid

checkBountyTweetsUsed(uint256,string).details: Can be used to proactively check for problems before the user submits a transaction

params._bountyId: The bounty to check for tweets used
params._postId: The twitter post to check if it was already used

checkBountyTweetsUsed(uint256,string).return: Returns true if the post has been used, otherwise it returns false

checkCalls().return: Returns true if the post has been used, otherwise it returns false

closeBounty(uint256).details: Only the bounty creator can call this function

params._bountyId: The bounty the owner wants to close

contribute(uint256).details: Note that these funds are under full control of the bounty creator, and the bounty can be closed and drained at any time

params._bountyId: The bounty that the user wants to contribute to

createBounty(uint256,string,string,strin.details: This function only works if the contract is not paused, if the fulfillment is greater than zero, there are room to make more bounties, and the tweet text has content.

params._follows: The post that will be used to establish the text requirements for this bounty
params._fulfillmentAmount: The amount a user will be paid when they fulfill a bounty
params._postId: The post that will be used to establish the text requirements for this bounty
params._topic: The amount a user will be paid when they fulfill a bounty

createBounty(uint256,string,string,strin.return: The bountyId that was created as a result of this function call

destroy().details: Transfers the current balance to the owner and terminates the contract.

fulfillBounty(uint256,string).details: This function only works if there are enough funds to pay someone and if the bounty is open.

params._bountyId: The bounty that the user is trying to fulfill
params._postId: The Twitter post that will be used to try and fulfill the bounty

fulfillBounty(uint256,string).return: Returns true if fulfillment completes. Can be used to check the function before it is actually run using .call()

getBounty(uint256).details: It does not include the mapping of tweets used to fulfill the bounty

params._bountyId: The bounty that should be retrieved

getBounty(uint256).return: A tuple of the bounty details

params._profileId: The twitter post to get the text for

getFollowers(string).return: Returns text for the twitter post, or in the case where the post hasn't been stored yet, it will return an empty string

params._bountyId: The bounty which has the fulfillment to be returned

getFulfillment(uint256,uint256).return: Returns a tuple of details for the fulfillment

getNumBounties().details: Can be used to iterate over all the bounties in the contract

getNumFulfillments(uint256).details: Can be used to iterate over all the fulfillments for a bounty

params._bountyId: The bounty to get the number of fulfillments for

getNumFulfillments(uint256).return: Returns the number of fulfillments for a bounty

getTweetText(string).details: Simply a passthrough function for the Twitter Oracle contract

params._postId: The twitter post to get the text for

getTweetText(string).return: Returns text for the twitter post, or in the case where the post hasn't been stored yet, it will return an empty string

params._profileId: The twitter post to retrieve and store in the Twitter Oracle contract

oraclizeTweet(string).details: The Twitter Oracle contract requires funds to support storing the Oraclize callback, which is why this function is Payable, and will forward funds to the Twitter Oracle

params._postId: The twitter post to retrieve and store in the Twitter Oracle contract

pause().details: called by the owner to pause, triggers stopped state

setCallCost(uint256).details: Only the owner of this contract can call this function

params._cost: the cost of creating a campaign

setOracle(address).details: Only the owner of this contract can call this function

params._addr: The address of the Twitter Oracle contract

transferOwnership(address).details: Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.

params.newOwner: The address to transfer ownership to.

unpause().details: called by the owner to unpause, returns to normal state

buyCalls().notice: Allows anyone to buy calls for creating campaigns

changePayout(uint256,uint256).notice: This function allows the owner of a bounty to change the fulfillment amount for that bounty

checkBountyTweetsUsed(uint256,string).notice: Checks if a specific Tweet has already been used for a bounty

closeBounty(uint256).notice: This function allows the owner of a bounty to close that bounty, and drain all funds from the bounty

contribute(uint256).notice: This function allows anyone to add additional funds to an open bounty

createBounty(uint256,string,string,strin.notice: This function will create a new open bounty using a stored tweet text

fulfillBounty(uint256,string).notice: This function allows any user to fulfill an open bounty using a post saved to the Twitter Oracle contract, and will automatically pay out

getBounty(uint256).notice: Returns the details of a bounty

getFulfillment(uint256,uint256).notice: Gets the fulfillment details for a specific bounty and fulfillment

getNumBounties().notice: Returns the number of bounties registered in the contract

getNumFulfillments(uint256).notice: Returns the number of fulfillments completed for a bounty

getTweetText(string).notice: Gets the tweet text for a twitter post from the Twitter Oracle

oraclizeTweet(string).notice: Requests the Twitter Oracle contract to retrieve and store the tweet text for a Twitter post

setOracle(address).notice: Allows the contract to update the Twitter Oracle it uses for creating bounties
